docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs help - Print this help message. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files. More Help Material Design https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/getting-started/

docs.text: Jenkins - create ssl certificate private key and cert-file to .p12 file cd C : \ OpenSSL .\ openssl pkcs12 -export -out server . p12 -inkey server . key -in server . crt // Set some password ! create java keystore and store the .p12 certificate in it cd "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\jre\bin" .\ keytool -importkeystore -srckeystore "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\ssl_ce rtificate\%Certificate%.p12" -srcstoretype pkcs12 -destkeystore "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\ssl_certificate\Jenkins.j ks" -deststoretype JK
docs.title: Create ssl certificate

docs.text: cd C : \ OpenSSL .\ openssl pkcs12 -export -out server . p12 -inkey server . key -in server . crt // Set some password !
docs.title: private key and cert-file to .p12 file

docs.text: cd "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\jre\bin" .\ keytool -importkeystore -srckeystore "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\ssl_ce rtificate\%Certificate%.p12" -srcstoretype pkcs12 -destkeystore "C:\Program Files (x86)\Jenkins\ssl_certificate\Jenkins.j ks" -deststoretype JK
docs.title: create java keystore and store the .p12 certificate in it

docs.text: Jenkins - Error creating bean with name 'authenticationManager' Failure Error creating bean with name 'authenticationManager': Cannot resolve reference to bean 'activeDirectory' while setting bean property 'providers' Done Stopped the Jenkins service, and unregistered and registered the service using the following in an administrative command prompt: cd \ Program Files ( x86 )\ Jenkins net stop jenkins jenkins uninstall jenkins install net start jenkins
docs.title: error_authenticationmanager

docs.text: Failure Error creating bean with name 'authenticationManager': Cannot resolve reference to bean 'activeDirectory' while setting bean property 'providers' Done Stopped the Jenkins service, and unregistered and registered the service using the following in an administrative command prompt: cd \ Program Files ( x86 )\ Jenkins net stop jenkins jenkins uninstall jenkins install net start jenkins
docs.title: Jenkins - Error creating bean with name 'authenticationManager'

docs.text: Outlook - keeps prompting for password Quote Managed to resolve this issue now. In the newest version of Office 2016, it looks for Autodiscover records at 365 first, before trying to use SCR etc. Older versions try to use SCP and HTTP methods, but now 365 is the default. This can be disabled With this reg key, which stops Outlook from trying to poll 365 autodiscover records first. Success [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Office\16.O\Outlook\AutoDiscover] "ExcludeExplicitO365Endpoint"=dword:00000001 Info This will probably not apply if you use 365 for your Exchange. We use on-prem Exchange 2010.
docs.title: keeps prompting for password

docs.text: Quote Managed to resolve this issue now. In the newest version of Office 2016, it looks for Autodiscover records at 365 first, before trying to use SCR etc. Older versions try to use SCP and HTTP methods, but now 365 is the default. This can be disabled With this reg key, which stops Outlook from trying to poll 365 autodiscover records first. Success [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Office\16.O\Outlook\AutoDiscover] "ExcludeExplicitO365Endpoint"=dword:00000001 Info This will probably not apply if you use 365 for your Exchange. We use on-prem Exchange 2010.
docs.title: Outlook - keeps prompting for password

docs.text: powershell - bypass certificate validiation Failure Error when using these cmdlets or these messages appear: TLS/SSL secure channel error Import-Module Invoke-"Commands" The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel. Solution Success if ( -not ( [System.Management.Automation.PSTypeName] 'ServerCertificateValidationCallback' ). Type ) { $certCallback = @" using System; using System.Net; using System.Net.Security; using System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates; public class ServerCertificateValidationCallback { public static void Ignore() { if(ServicePointManager.ServerCertificateValidationCallback ==null) { ServicePointManager.ServerCertificateValidationCallback += delegate ( Object obj, X509Certificate certificate, X509Chain chain, SslPolicyErrors errors ) { return true; }; } } } "@ Add-Type $certCallback } [ServerCertificateValidationCallback] :: Ignore ()
docs.title: bypass certifcate validation

docs.text: Failure
docs.title: powershell - bypass certificate validiation

docs.text: TLS/SSL secure channel error Import-Module Invoke-"Commands" The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel.
docs.title: Error when using these cmdlets or these messages appear:

docs.text: Success if ( -not ( [System.Management.Automation.PSTypeName] 'ServerCertificateValidationCallback' ). Type ) { $certCallback = @" using System; using System.Net; using System.Net.Security; using System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates; public class ServerCertificateValidationCallback { public static void Ignore() { if(ServicePointManager.ServerCertificateValidationCallback ==null) { ServicePointManager.ServerCertificateValidationCallback += delegate ( Object obj, X509Certificate certificate, X509Chain chain, SslPolicyErrors errors ) { return true; }; } } } "@ Add-Type $certCallback } [ServerCertificateValidationCallback] :: Ignore ()
docs.title: Solution

docs.text: powershell - calculated properties Definition Calculated properties allow you to create new properties or change existing ones at run-time. This is done by passing a specially crafted hashtable to the Property parameter rather than a static property name. Below is an example of a calculated property hashtable. @{ Name = '' ; Expression = {}} Example original command example: Get-WmiObject win32_computersystem | Select-Object TotalPhysicalMemory TotalPhysicalMemory ------------------- 2147012608 calculated property example: Get-WmiObject win32_computersystem | Select @{ Name = 'RAM (in GB)' ; Expression = { $_ . TotalPhysicalMemory / 1GB }} RAM ( in GB ) --- 1 , 99956130981445
docs.title: calculated expressions
